section_title: Alteration of the style of Parliament.
section_text: 2 1 Parliament shall hereafter be known as and styled the Parliament of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland; . . .  2 In every . . .   public document issued after the passing of this Act the expression “United Kingdom” shall, unless the context otherwise requires, mean Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
3 This Act may be cited as the Royal and Parliamentary Titles Act 1927.
